flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
The kit can be purchased here: https://www.trossenrobotics.com/p/Turtle...

It is a ready-to-build kit based upon the original TurtleBot Robot Arm found here: Build an Arm for Your TurtleBot

This build guide assumes that you know how AX-12 brackets are mounted to AX-12 servos. You must seat M2 nuts into the rows of sockets prior to bolting them down. Please refer to this video for instruction:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o0JtXuj7H...

We also recommend the use of Loc-tite or a similar threadlocker:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ISpqtMfSG...

Please note that the AX-12A servos that come with this kit have pre-assigned IDs.
guide.introduction_rendered:
The kit can be purchased here: https://www.trossenrobotics.com/p/Turtle...

It is a ready-to-build kit based upon the original TurtleBot Robot Arm found here: Build an Arm for Your TurtleBot

This build guide assumes that you know how AX-12 brackets are mounted to AX-12 servos. You must seat M2 nuts into the rows of sockets prior to bolting them down. Please refer to this video for instruction:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o0JtXuj7H...

We also recommend the use of Loc-tite or a similar threadlocker:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ISpqtMfSG...

Please note that the AX-12A servos that come with this kit have pre-assigned IDs.

Relevant parts
  • See Step 1
Tools
  • 1.5mm Hex Wrench
  • 1/16 Hex Wrench
  • 2.5mm Hex Wrench
  • 5/64 Hex Wrench
  • Scissors (to cut foam)
  • Small Phillips Head Screw Driver

lines.text: Parts List  Note: Some of the parts in some assemblies come packaged in seperate smaller bags because they come with a bracket or other various part. Please review the entire parts list to ensure you have all necessary components. Some kits will have spare bolts, nuts, or screws included.
lines.text_raw: Parts List  Note: Some of the parts in some assemblies come packaged in seperate smaller bags because they come with a bracket or other various part. Please review the entire parts list to ensure you have all necessary components. Some kits will have spare bolts, nuts, or screws included.

lines.text: Make note of the servo IDs and their positions. Each servo has a # written on the back of it. Be sure you assemble the servos in the     correct order so that your arm will work!
lines.text_raw: Make note of the servo IDs and their positions. Each servo has a # written on the back of it. Be sure you assemble the servos in the     correct order so that your arm will work!

lines.text: Build TWO bracket assemblies by mounting the F4 bracket to the F3 bracket as shown with two spacer brackets inbetween.
lines.text_raw: Build TWO bracket assemblies by mounting the F4 bracket to the F3 bracket as shown with two spacer brackets inbetween.

lines.text: Next, attach the bracket assemblies to servos #3 and #4.
lines.text_raw: Next, attach the bracket assemblies to servos #3 and #4.

lines.text: Bolt the assemblies together by connecing the #3 servo horn to the other F4 bracket.
lines.text_raw: Bolt the assemblies together by connecing the #3 servo horn to the other F4 bracket.

lines.text: Note the orientation of the gripper finger side rails. The inside corner on one side has extra bracing. This is the front-outside end of the fingers. Make sure these sides are paired up properly during assembly steps.
lines.text_raw: Note the orientation of the gripper finger side rails. The inside corner on one side has extra bracing. This is the front-outside end of the fingers. Make sure these sides are paired up properly during assembly steps.

lines.text: It helps to layout the parts as shown so that everything makes sense. You will build the Gripper Fingers by first using the 6 parts in the two center rows.
lines.text_raw: It helps to layout the parts as shown so that everything makes sense. You will build the Gripper Fingers by first using the 6 parts in the two center rows.

lines.text: Assemble the Gripper Fingers as shown. You want the textured side of the Side Rails facing out on both the top and bottom. The textured side of the center pieces should face out. Tighten the bolts nice and snug, but don't strip the standoffs.
lines.text_raw: Assemble the Gripper Fingers as shown. You want the textured side of the Side Rails facing out on both the top and bottom. The textured side of the center pieces should face out. Tighten the bolts nice and snug, but don't strip the standoffs.

lines.text: Place the spacers on the inside of each Finger as shown with the smooth sides exposed.
lines.text_raw: Place the spacers on the inside of each Finger as shown with the smooth sides exposed.

lines.text: Bolt the Fingertip spacers doen using M2x6 Hex Socket Head Bolts. The bolts go on the outside of the finger. They go through the finger and will self-tap into the ABS spacer.
lines.text_raw: Bolt the Fingertip spacers doen using M2x6 Hex Socket Head Bolts. The bolts go on the outside of the finger. They go through the finger and will self-tap into the ABS spacer.

lines.text: For the following steps you want to tap the M2 nuts into their seats. A few gentle-medium taps using a DIY punch will get the job done. This will secure the nuts nice and tight so it is easier to get the bolts threading.
lines.text_raw: For the following steps you want to tap the M2 nuts into their seats. A few gentle-medium taps using a DIY punch will get the job done. This will secure the nuts nice and tight so it is easier to get the bolts threading.

lines.text: First prep the F2 and F3 bracket as shown. It is easiest to put the nuts in the F3 bracket and run the bolt through the F2 bracket.
lines.text_raw: First prep the F2 and F3 bracket as shown. It is easiest to put the nuts in the F3 bracket and run the bolt through the F2 bracket.

lines.text: With the remaining two F2 and F3 brackets tap in 8 M2 Nuts in the positions shown. This is in preperation for mounting the Gripper Fingers later.
lines.text_raw: With the remaining two F2 and F3 brackets tap in 8 M2 Nuts in the positions shown. This is in preperation for mounting the Gripper Fingers later.

lines.text: Mount the F2 and F3 brackets on to your servo as shown.
lines.text_raw: Mount the F2 and F3 brackets on to your servo as shown.

lines.text: Now mount your bracket assembly as shown. Make sure to mount using the right bracket holes so that your gripper will be centered.
lines.text_raw: Now mount your bracket assembly as shown. Make sure to mount using the right bracket holes so that your gripper will be centered.

lines.text: Attach the Right Gripper Finger as shown with 4 M2x10 Hex Socket Head bolts.
lines.text_raw: Attach the Right Gripper Finger as shown with 4 M2x10 Hex Socket Head bolts.

lines.text: Attach the Left Gripper Finger as shown with 4 M2x10 Hex Socket Head bolts.
lines.text_raw: Attach the Left Gripper Finger as shown with 4 M2x10 Hex Socket Head bolts.

lines.text: The gripper comes with a strip of 1" X 1/8" foam. If your project requires a softer gripper finger, then cut the foam to size and apply as shown.
lines.text_raw: The gripper comes with a strip of 1" X 1/8" foam. If your project requires a softer gripper finger, then cut the foam to size and apply as shown.

lines.text: Attach the gripper as shown to the horn of the #4 servo. Be careful to pay attention and not put it on upside down.
lines.text_raw: Attach the gripper as shown to the horn of the #4 servo. Be careful to pay attention and not put it on upside down.

lines.text: Mount the #1 servo into the Base Plate.
lines.text_raw: Mount the #1 servo into the Base Plate.

lines.text: Mount an F3 Bracket to the servo horn.
lines.text_raw: Mount an F3 Bracket to the servo horn.

lines.text: Screw the M/F 6-32 3/4" standoff into the F/F 6-32 1.25" standoff. Tighten them snugly by rotating about a quarter turn past when the faces touch.
lines.text_raw: Screw the M/F 6-32 3/4" standoff into the F/F 6-32 1.25" standoff. Tighten them snugly by rotating about a quarter turn past when the faces touch.

lines.text: Bolt the standoff assemblies onto the Base Plate.
lines.text_raw: Bolt the standoff assemblies onto the Base Plate.

lines.text: Mount the upper arm assembly to the base assembly.
lines.text_raw: Mount the upper arm assembly to the base assembly.

lines.text: Run the Gripper cable through the F2 bracket cable guide slots.
lines.text_raw: Run the Gripper cable through the F2 bracket cable guide slots.

lines.text: Do the same on the next 2 cables/servos, but just use one slot on each bracket.
lines.text_raw: Do the same on the next 2 cables/servos, but just use one slot on each bracket.

lines.text: Wire up your Base Rotate Servo, and use another cable to go from this servo to the Arbotix, and you are all done.
lines.text_raw: Wire up your Base Rotate Servo, and use another cable to go from this servo to the Arbotix, and you are all done.

lines.text: Check out the next build guide for info on wiring up the arm to your arbotix, and powering the arbotix! Wiring and Attaching an Arm to Your TurtleBot
lines.text_raw: Check out the next build guide for info on wiring up the arm to your arbotix, and powering the arbotix! [guide|1335]

guide.summary: The TurtleBot AX-12 Robotic Arm is a 5 degree-of-freedom robotic arm and an easy addition to the TurtleBot ROS robot platform. This hardware kit comes with everything needed to physically assemble and mount the arm.
guide.title: Build a TurtleBot Robotic Arm (Trossen Robotics version)
